intro: Hieracium hypomallum, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium hypomallum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-poor environments.
